item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. NASA spacecraft to probe possibility of life in Europa's salty ocean (75 points | 40 comments)
2. FRED: New Zealand open-access and crowdsource database of fossil records (38 points | 4 comments)
3. Hack GPON – how to access, change and edit fibre ONTs (122 points | 60 comments)
4. Insights after 11 years with Datomic [video] (93 points | 14 comments)
5. On Impactful AI Research (183 points | 32 comments)
6. Social Web Foundation launches, supported by Vivaldi (6 points | 3 comments)
7. Show HN: Hosting my website using my C web server (182 points | 58 comments)
8. Furnace – the biggest multi-system chiptune tracker ever made (94 points | 27 comments)
9. Beyond the route: Introducing granular MTA bus speed data (180 points | 50 comments)
10. Launch HN: Modern Realty (YC S24) – AI Real Estate Agent for Home Buyers (132 points | 257 comments)
11. Why are the violins the biggest section in the orchestra? (54 points | 39 comments)
12. Understudied protein blobs have global effects on cell biochemistry (40 points | 8 comments)
13. Why Most Published Research Findings Are False (2005) (172 points | 189 comments)
14. The Calculator that spawned the Microprocessor (2009) (88 points | 23 comments)
15. Doom on a modified rotary phone (70 points | 23 comments)
16. A Little History of the Anchovy (42 points | 15 comments)
17. Show HN: Velvet – Store OpenAI requests in your own DB (64 points | 32 comments)
18. Show HN: OpenFreeMap – Open-Source Map Hosting (744 points | 206 comments)
19. GSoC'24: Differentiable Logic for Interactive Systems and Generative Music (78 points | 7 comments)
20. Ask HN: Platform for 11 year old to create video games? (75 points | 85 comments)
21. Death of the Department Store (61 points | 80 comments)
22. Working Turing Machine (89 points | 2 comments)
23. Filtered for home robots, fast and slow (19 points | 10 comments)
24. How We Sort the World (11 points | 2 comments)
25. Wasm2Mpy: Compiling WASM to MicroPython so it can run on Raspberrys (73 points | 23 comments)
26. Neat Randomized Algorithms: RandDiag for Rapidly Diagonalizing Normal Matrices (61 points | 4 comments)
27. Google Cache is fully dead (273 points | 154 comments)
28. Move Fast and Abandon Things (409 points | 188 comments)
29. Hacker plants false memories in ChatGPT to steal user data in perpetuity (170 points | 69 comments)
30. Mkfs.fat on Linux vs. OS/2 2.1 (11 points | 3 comments)
